newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli provident redemptions fell in October.
newsitem.headline: Israeli provident redemptions fell in October.

text.p: Net redemptions in Israeli provident funds fell to 1.062 billion shekels in October, compared with 3.511 billion shekels the month before, the Treasury capital markets division said on Thursday.

The figure marked a sharp decline from the previous three months when the funds, long-term savings schemes that invest most of their assets in Treasury bonds, experienced a sharp increase in redemptions.
In the first 10 months, net provident fund redemptions came to 11.949 billion shekels.

The Treasury said savings promgrammes enjoyed a net inflow of new money amounting to 234.8 million shekels in October. That was down from 1.937 billion shekels in September and brought the 10-month figure to 5.404 billion shekels.
